p: Tuberculosis (TB) is a respiratory infectious disease transmitted through inhalation of Mycobacterium tuberculosis ( Mtb) in aerosolized droplet nuclei [ 1]. High population density, human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, poverty, air pollution, population displacements and malnutrition increases the risk of successful TB transmission [ 2â€“ 4] Host characteristics like infectiousness of the infected, number of susceptible individuals, frequency of interaction and social mixing patterns plus virulence of the pathogen promote successful transmission of Mtb [ 5].
